name: Slack
help: Slack is a cloud-based set of proprietary team collaboration tools and services, founded by Stewart Butterfield. Slack began as an internal tool used by his company, Tiny Speck, in the development of Glitch, a now defunct online game.

properties.name: Text
properties.help: Slack messages may be formatted using a simple markup language similar to Markdown. Supported formatting includes: ```pre```, `code`, _italic_, *bold*, and even ~strike~.; full details are available on our help site.

properties.name: Markdown
properties.help: By default bot message text will be formatted. To disable formatting on a non-user message, set the <c>mrkdwn</c> property to <c>false</c>.

properties.name: Attachments
properties.help: Attachments let you add more context to a message, making them more useful and effective.

properties.name: Title
properties.help: The title is displayed as larger, bold text near the top of a message attachment.

properties.name: TitleLink
properties.help: Hyperlink used for the title.

properties.name: PreText
properties.help: This is optional text that appears above the message attachment block.

properties.name: Text
properties.help: This is the main text in a message attachment, and can contain standard message markup. The content will automatically collapse if it contains 700+ characters or 5+ linebreaks, and will display a "Show more..." link to expand the content. Links posted in the text field will not unfurl.

properties.name: MarkdownIn
properties.help: By default bot message attachments will not be formatted. To enable formatting on attachment fields, set the mrkdwn_in array on each attachment to the list of fields to process.

properties.name: Fallback
properties.help: A plain-text summary of the attachment. This text will be used in clients that don't show formatted text (eg. IRC, mobile notifications) and should not contain any markup.

properties.name: Color
properties.help: Like traffic signals, color-coding messages can quickly communicate intent and help separate them from the flow of other messages in the timeline.<para/>An optional value that can either be one of good, warning, danger, or any hex color code (eg. #439FE0). This value is used to color the border along the left side of the message attachment.

properties.name: AuthorName
properties.help: Small text used to display the author's name.

properties.name: AuthorLink
properties.help: A valid URL that will hyperlink the <c>author_name</c> text mentioned above. Will only work if <c>author_name</c> is present.

properties.name: AuthorIcon
properties.help: A valid URL that displays a small 16x16px image to the left of the <c>author_name</c> text. Will only work if <c>author_name</c> is present.

properties.name: ImageUrl
properties.help: A valid URL to an image file that will be displayed inside a message attachment. We currently support the following formats: GIF, JPEG, PNG, and BMP.<para/>Large images will be resized to a maximum width of 360px or a maximum height of 500px, while still maintaining the original aspect ratio.

properties.name: ThumbUrl
properties.help: A valid URL to an image file that will be displayed as a thumbnail on the right side of a message attachment. We currently support the following formats: GIF, JPEG, PNG, and BMP.<para/>The thumbnail's longest dimension will be scaled down to 75px while maintaining the aspect ratio of the image. The filesize of the image must also be less than 500 KB.<para/>For best results, please use images that are already 75px by 75px.

properties.name: Footer
properties.help: Add some brief text to help contextualize and identify an attachment. Limited to 300 characters, and may be truncated further when displayed to users in environments with limited screen real estate.

properties.name: FooterIcon
properties.help: To render a small icon beside your <c>footer</c> text, provide a publicly accessible URL string in the <c>footer_icon</c> field. You must also provide a <c>footer</c> for the field to be recognized.<para/>We'll render what you provide at 16px by 16px. It's best to use an image that is similarly sized.<para/>Example: <c>https://platform.slack-edge.com/img/default_application_icon.png</c>

properties.name: Timestamp
properties.help: Does your attachment relate to something happening at a specific time?By providing the ts field with an integer value in "epoch time", the attachment will display an additional timestamp value as part of the attachment's footer.Use ts when referencing articles or happenings. Your message will have its own timestamp when published.Example: Providing 123456789 would result in a rendered timestamp of Nov 29th, 1973.

properties.name: Fields
properties.help: Fields get displayed in a table-like way.

properties.name: Title
properties.help: Shown as a bold heading above the <c>value</c> text. It cannot contain markup and will be escaped for you.

properties.name: Value
properties.help: The text value of the field. It may contain standard message markup and must be escaped as normal. May be multi-line.

properties.name: Short
properties.help: An optional flag indicating whether the <c>value</c> is short enough to be displayed side-by-side with other values.
